Underwater exploration would become a popular activity for both tourists and scientists. This would lead to new discoveries and insights into marine life, ecosystems, and underwater landscapes.
The fishing industry would be revolutionized, with fishermen no longer needing to use nets or other equipment to catch fish. This would lead to more sustainable and eco-friendly fishing practices.
Marine conservation efforts would be more effective, as people would be able to observe and protect marine life up close without disrupting the environment.
The use of underwater vehicles, such as submarines and remotely operated vehicles (ROVs), would become more common, leading to new technologies and innovations in underwater exploration and research.
The construction industry would see a shift towards building structures and infrastructure that are more resistant to corrosion and wear caused by exposure to water.
